org.jtrim.image.transform

Class ImageTransformerQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.transform.ImageTransformerQuery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsyncDataQuery<ImageTransformerData,TransformedImageData>

    public final class ImageTransformerQuery
extends java.lang.Object
implements AsyncDataQuery<ImageTransformerData,TransformedImageData>
    Defines an AsyncDataQuery which transforms its input image on the specified TaskExecutorService. There can be multiple transformations defined, each defining a more and more accurate transformation. That is, ImageTransformerLink applies each transformation to its input and forwards each transformed image assuming that the last transformation applied is the most accurate one.

    Note that essentially each transformation defines the same transformation, they should only differ in the accuracy of their result.

    This class is effectively a factory for ImageTransformerLink instances. That is, the createDataLink method creates an ImageTransformerLink with the arguments specified at construction time.

    Thread safety

    The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    AsyncImageDisplay, ImageTransformerLink

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageTransformerQuery

        public ImageTransformerQuery(TaskExecutorService executor,
                     ImageTransformer... imageTransformers)
        Creates a new ImageTransformerQuery which will execute the image transformations on the specified executor.
        Parameters:
        executor - the TaskExecutorService on which the image transformers are called. Each image transformation is called in a separate task submitted to this executor. This argument cannot be null.
        imageTransformers - the transformations to be applied to the input image. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - throw if the specified executor or the image transformation array or any of its transformation is null

      • ImageTransformerQuery

        public ImageTransformerQuery(java.util.List<AsyncDataConverter<ImageTransformerData,TransformedImage>> imageTransformers)
        Creates a new ImageTransformerQuery applying the specified image transformations on input images. The transformations are executed on the associated TaskExecutorService.
        Parameters:
        imageTransformers - the transformations (with their associated TaskExecutorService) to be applied to the input image. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified image transformation list is null or contains null elements

    • Method Detail

      • createDataLink

        public ImageTransformerLink createDataLink(ImageTransformerData arg)
        Creates a AsyncDataLink which will provide data based on the specified input.

        This method must return immediately without blocking and should not actually start retrieving the requested data (not in way detectable by the user but for example: prefetching is allowed).

        Specified by:
        createDataLink in interface AsyncDataQuery<ImageTransformerData,TransformedImageData>
        Parameters:
        arg - the input argument which is to be used to retrieve the data. It is implementation dependent if null is allowed as an argument.
        Returns:
        the AsyncDataLink which will provide data based on the specified input. This method never returns null.
